velocyto.estimation module¶

velocyto.estimation.clusters_stats(U: numpy.ndarray, S: numpy.ndarray, clusters_uid: numpy.ndarray, cluster_ix: numpy.ndarray, size_limit: int = 40) → typing.Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray][source]¶

Calculate the averages per cluster

If the cluster is too small (size<size_limit) the average of the toal is reported instead

velocyto.estimation.colDeltaCor(emat: numpy.ndarray, dmat: numpy.ndarray, threads: int = None) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Calculate the correlation between the displacement (d[:,i]) and the difference between a cell and every other (e - e[:, i])

Parallel cython+OpenMP implemetation

Parameters:
  • emat (np.ndarray (ngenes, ncells)) – gene expression matrix
  • dmat (np.ndarray (ngenes, ncells)) – gene velocity/displacement matrix
  • threads (int) – number of parallel threads to use

velocyto.estimation.colDeltaCorLog10partial(emat: numpy.ndarray, dmat: numpy.ndarray, ixs: numpy.ndarray, threads: int = None, psc: float = 1.0) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Calculate the correlation between the displacement (d[:,i]) and the difference between a cell and every other (e - e[:, i])

Parallel cython+OpenMP implemetation

Parameters:
  • emat (np.ndarray (ngenes, ncells)) – gene expression matrix
  • dmat (np.ndarray (ngenes, ncells)) – gene velocity/displacement matrix
  • ixs (the neighborhood matrix (ncells, nneighbours)) – ixs[i, k] is the kth neighbour to the cell i
  • threads (int) – number of parallel threads to use

velocyto.estimation.estimate_velocity(U: numpy.ndarray, S: numpy.ndarray, steadystate: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Estimate velocity for all the genes using gene-relative model (numpy version)

Parameters:
  • U (np.ndarray (genes, cells)) – The unspliced molecule count
  • S (np.ndarray (genes, cells)) – The spliced molecule count
  • steadystate (np.ndarray(bool), shape=cells) – A boolean array, True when the cell is a steady state cell
Returns:

  • velcity (np.ndarray (shape=S.shape)) – The velocity for every gene.
  • NOTE
  • Special caseses – if not np.any(S[gene, steadystate]): delta = NaN if not np.any(U[gene, steadystate]): delta = 0
velocyto.estimation.fit_slope(Y: numpy.ndarray, X: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Loop through the genes and fits the slope

Y: np.ndarray, shape=(genes, cells)
the dependent variable (unspliced)
X: np.ndarray, shape=(genes, cells)
the independent variable (spliced)
velocyto.estimation.fit_slope_multiq(U: numpy.ndarray, S: numpy.ndarray, labels: numpy.ndarray, q_positive: bool = False) → typing.Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray][source]¶

Neighbour wise fit of gamma with multiple qs input shoud be (cells, genes) sic!

Returns:
  • gammas (np.ndarray = (genes))
  • qs (np.ndarray, shape = (neighborhoods, genes))
velocyto.estimation.fit_slope_multiq_reg(U: numpy.ndarray, S: numpy.ndarray, CS: numpy.ndarray, labels: numpy.ndarray, graph_design: scipy.sparse.csr.csr_matrix, alpha: float, kind_objective: str = 'project_q', q_positive: bool = False) → typing.Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray][source]¶

Neighbour wise fit of gamma with multiple qs and regularization using the neighborhoods q smoothing input should be (cells, genes) sic!

Parameters:
  • U (np.ndarray (cells, genes)) – Unspliced molecules table or correspondent non negative components
  • S (np.ndarray (cells, genes)) – Spliced molecules table or correspondent non negative components
  • CS (np.ndarray, shape=(n_centroids, genes)) – Centroids coordinates
  • labels (np.ndarray) – labels of the neighborhood, must be dense for 0 to n
  • graph_design (sparse.csr_matrix) – a sparse matrix with weights used in the regularization as values
  • alpha (float) – how strongly the regularization weights over the least squares
  • kind_objective (str) –
    “project_q”: projects q on the vector that contains the centroid and
    then impose that q is similar to the mean of the projected vectors

    ”neighborhood”: then impose that q is similar to the mean of the neighbours In both cases the weights are determined by the input graph_design

  • q_positive (bool, default=False) – Wether to constrain q to positive values
Returns:

  • gammas (np.ndarray = (genes, neighborhoods))
  • qs (np.ndarray, shape = (genes, neighborhoods))
